English:
You look delicious. I wonder what your soul tastes
like?
Chinese:
你看起來真好吃。
你的靈魂嘗起來是怎樣的味道呢？
Korean:
너, 맛있어 보이네.
어떤 맛이 나는 영혼일까?
German:
Du siehst lecker aus. Wie wohl deine Seele
schmeckt?

English: Eek! Don't come near me!
Chinese: 咿，別、別過來！
German: Aaah! Komm mir nicht zu nahe!

English:
You have strayed into my domain. You're shaking.
Are you scared? Hehehe.
Chinese:
明明是你們自己過來的吧？
你在發抖呢，很害怕嗎？
嘻嘻嘻，表情真棒。
Korean:
너희가 와 놓고서는 뭐야?
떨고 있잖아. 무서워?
히히히, 표정 좋은데
German:
Du hast mein Gebiet betreten. Du zitterst.
Hast du Angst? Hehehe.

English: You're just a D-Digimon... Yo-you don't scare me!
Chinese:
不、不過是個數碼寶貝，
別太囂張了。
Korean:
디, 디지몬 주제에
우쭐해 하지 마
German:
Du bist nur ein D-Digimon ... D-Du machst mir
keine Angst.

English:
This human also looks very tasty. Which one shall
I devour first?
Chinese:
這邊的靈魂似乎也很美味，
就由你先吃起吧？
Korean:
이쪽 인간의 영혼도 맛있어 보이네.
이쪽부터 먹을까?
German:
Dieser Mensch wirkt auch sehr lecker. Welchen
soll ich zuerst verschlingen?

English: Eek!
German: Aaah!

English:
Go on, Bakemon! Eat their souls! They thought it
would be fun to come looking for a ghost.
Chinese:
很好啊猛鬼獸，就這樣吃掉人類的靈魂！
誰叫這些人只因為有趣就跑到這裡。
Korean:
좋아 고스몬, 그대로 인간의 영혼을 먹는 거다!
얘네는 반쯤 장난으로 여기 왔으니까
German:
Los, Bakemon! Friss ihre Seelen auf! Sie dachten,
es wäre lustig, nach einem Geist zu suchen.

English: Let's get out of here!
Chinese: 這些傢伙太危險了，快逃吧！
German: Nichts wie weg hier!

English: We won't let you go that easily.
Chinese: 別以為逃得掉。
German: So leicht kommt ihr uns nicht davon.

English: Hmm... Shall I eat them one at a time?
Chinese: 來一個個慢慢品嘗好了。
Korean: 한 명씩 맛보면서 먹는 게 좋을까
German: Hm ... Soll ich sie nacheinander fressen?

English: Or both at once?
Chinese:
或者說還是要奢侈點，
一口氣吃兩個人呢？
Korean:
아니면 사치스럽게
둘 다 한꺼번에 먹는 게 좋을까
German: Oder beide gleichzeitig?

English: Either way is fine. Make them tremble even more!
Chinese:
隨便啦，
讓人類更害怕吧！
Korean:
뭐든 좋으니까
인간을 더 떨게 만들라고!
German: Beides ist gut. Sie sollen noch mehr zittern!

English: Stay b-back!
Chinese: 別過來……別過來！
German: B-Bleibt mir vom Leib!

English: Who are you?
Chinese: 你是幹麻的？
German: Wer bist du?

English: Have you come to let me eat you, too?
Chinese: 你也是來讓我吃的嗎？
German:
Bist du gekommen, damit ich dich auch fressen
kann?

English: People are telling stories about a ghost?
Chinese: 你說幽靈出沒的謠言？
German: Es kursieren Geschichten über einen Geist?

English: Of course. I told Bakemon to scare the humans.
Chinese:
沒錯，那可是我刻意命令猛鬼獸，
要他嚇唬人類的。
Korean:
그래, 일부러 바로 내가
고스몬한테 명령해서 인간에게 겁을 주고 있거든
German:
Natürlich. Ich habe Bakemon gesagt, dass es
Menschen Angst machen soll.

English:
Why? Because it's fun. Why else? The terrified
looks on their faces is hilarious.
Chinese:
你為我為什麼？當然是因為惡作劇很有趣啊。
人類驚訝的表情實在太好玩了。
Korean:
왜라니, 당연히 장난이 재미있으니까
그런 거지.
인간이 놀라는 얼굴이 정말로 재밌거든
German:
Warum? Weil es Spaß macht. Warum sonst? Der
verängstigte Blick auf ihren Gesichtern ist
urkomisch.

English: So you aren't really going to eat our souls?
Chinese: 你說吞食靈魂只是嚇唬人的嗎？
Korean:
영혼을 먹는단 건
그냥 장난이었던 거야?
German:
Du wirst also nicht wirklich unsere Seelen
fressen?

English: I can if you want me to.
Chinese: 你想要的話，真的吃下去也沒問題啊。
German: Wenn du das möchtest, kann ich es schon machen.

English: Eek!
Chinese: 咿！
German: Aaah!

English: You want us to stop?
Chinese: 你要我停止對人惡作劇？
German: Du willst, dass wir aufhören?

English: No way! We're gonna do it even more!
Chinese:
才不要，
我要對人類做更多更多惡作劇！
German: Niemals! Wir werden das noch öfter machen!
